snippet: Efforts by the United States to frame a United Nations Security Council resolution seeking humanitarian access to shattered neighborhoods in the central Syrian city of Homs were rejected.
abstract: Antigovernment protests in Syria descend into skirmishes in several towns and cities following the end of the government's wholesale assault on the central city of Homs; government of Pres Bashar al-Assad is reportedly employing gruesome methods to do away with evidence of the assault before admitting aid from the International Committee of the Red Cross.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Beirut, Michael Schwirtz from Moscow, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Efforts by the United States to frame a United Nations Security Council resolution seeking humanitarian access to shattered neighborhoods in the central Syrian city of Homs were rejected.

headline.seo: Syria Rushes to Scrub Signs of Assault on Homs
headline.main: More Violence in Syria as Forces Scramble to Scrub Signs of Assault on Homs
headline.print_headline: Syrian Clashes Continue as Forces Scramble to Scrub Signs of Homs Assault
